title: What are some good iron maiden albums
content:
okay i know i'm a true maiden fan so what are some good iron maiden albums

i legally own
7th son of a 7th son
fear of the dark
the number of the beast

i hope to buy no prayer for the dying this weekend as jb-hifi are having a sale which most of the older titles are $10 each so if i find it in melbourne for $10 i'll grab it

anyway enuff of that, can somebody point me to some of their really good albums, anybody, djaser perhaps?Rorie

title: Re: What are some good iron maiden albums
content:
Forget about No prayer for the moment and get yourself their self-titled album, Piece of mind, powerslave, Brave new world, and a matter of life and death first.

No prayer is really their least good album (least=better than bad) so you should get yourself that one as last. Unless you think that Fear of the dark is the best album you own because they are more or less comparable.-----------------
[img]http://www.jamster.co.uk/s/jcw/img/logo_jamster_navi.gif[/img][img]http://www.jamster.co.uk/storage/view/335/0/cr/CrazyFrog___Axel_F_Falling.gif[/img]

too late i already brought no prayer for the dying & i also got somewhere in time both for $20 each but thank you for your opinion, i was thinking about buying powerslave sunday but by the time i thought of it it was too late well there's always the jb-hihi in geelong market square where the safeway supermarket used to beRorie

title: Re: What are some good iron maiden albums
content:
Somewhere in time might not be a bad choise either but it's one of the few Maiden albums I just can't get into. Probably because the poorly remastered version, so I hope you got yourself the original version.-----------------
